column4: anyone knows anything about the "Setting '802-1x' is empty, discarding" problem?

I can still connect to the router wirelessly via Windows or even a DS, but the Ubuntu will only connect wired(like I'm doing now :( ), and knetworkmanager gives me this strange "Setting '802-1x' is empty, discarding" message. Anyone know why?
or, even better, how to solve this?
WPA or WEP?
No WPA doesn't work, uhm... Are you hex key or... string?
does it even make any difference?
I mean, in this case?
Don't answer then =p
sorry, I'm just asking, because if it does it might be the problem
and I already answered Hex
40-bit hex key
Have you chosen the key as WEP hex?
yes, WEP 40/128-bit Hexadecimal, as knetworkmanager says
There is two options? (maybe more) one is Wep Hex -- choose that one.
strangest thing is: yesterday night it was fine, and then today by morning it stopped connecting
Update recently?
no
I did install hibernate, but that was before
and then I installed octave
but I'm not sure if before or after my first hibernation test
any clue?
